definition: a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: At once I stood up and said it was too inconvenient, I then walked quickly to follow him.
sentences.chinese: 我立即起身說那太麻煩了，就疾步跟過去。

sentences.english: He heard a horse approaching ata spanking trot.
sentences.chinese: 他聽到一匹馬正在疾步馳近。

sentences.english: Old Nick went off with that load as if there were nothing in the cart.
sentences.chinese: 老尼克疾步如飛，就像拉着一輛空車一樣。

sentences.english: On the international stage, many countries are moving at fast pace into the cashless society.
sentences.chinese: 在國際舞臺上，許多國家正疾步踏入無現金社會。

sentences.english: You tell me to go, I start walkin out.
sentences.chinese: 妳告訴我妳必須走了，我開始疾步追趕妳。

sentences.english: They stood as the president walked quickly to the front.
sentences.chinese: 他們站在作爲總統疾步向前方。

sentences.english: At last, he whispered a hurried goodbye to his host and darted toward the door.
sentences.chinese: 最後，他匆匆地向主人輕聲道別，疾步走向門口。

sentences.english: At last, he whispered a hurried goodbye to his host and darted toward door.
sentences.chinese: 最後，他匆匆地向主任輕聲道別，疾步走向門口。

definition: at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
